summary: Email exchange between Assistant United States Attorney Reid Weingarten and defense attorney Michael Miller regarding logistics for delivering a hard drive containing discovery materials in the Jeffrey Epstein case, and discussion of compliance with a protective order ahead of a court conference.

persons.name: Reid Weingarten
persons.context: Prosecutor in the Southern District of New York corresponding about receiving a hard drive from the defense and inquiring about the defense's position regarding a subpoena.

persons.name: Michael Miller
persons.role: Defense Attorney, Partner at Steptoe & Johnson LLP
persons.context: Defense attorney representing Jeffrey Epstein, arranging to deliver a hard drive with discovery materials to the prosecution and discussing compliance with a protective order.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the case; the email exchange concerns discovery materials and legal proceedings related to his prosecution.

connections.description: Miller is a defense attorney representing Epstein, as indicated by his reference to the 'Epstein defense team'.
Weingarten is an Assistant U.S. Attorney prosecuting the case against Epstein.
Prosecutor and defense attorney communicating about discovery logistics and legal compliance in the Epstein case.

events.title: Upcoming Court Conference
events.description: A court conference is scheduled for the morning after this email exchange, where discovery compliance and a subpoena position were to be discussed.

locations: 1 St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
1114 Avenue of the Americas, New York, NY 10036
keyFacts: The defense team for Jeffrey Epstein was in the process of providing discovery materials to prosecutors on a hard drive.
There was an active protective order governing the discovery process that the defense claimed to be in compliance with.
The prosecution was seeking the defense's position on a subpoena that had been previously discussed.
The correspondence shows logistical coordination between prosecution and defense ahead of a court conference.
Michael Miller was a partner at Steptoe & Johnson LLP representing Epstein.
